title: Syria and Lebanon: The search for a fresh start since Assad's fall and Hezbollah's collapse
subhead: Beirut is seeking to build a relationship on equal footing with the new authorities in Damascus, but progress has remained slow. The weight of history, particularly Syria's tutelage over Lebanon from 1990 to 2005 and Hezbollah's involvement alongside the Assad regime from 2012 to 2024, has fueled mistrust.

title: US press freedom under scrutiny after arrest of two journalists during Minneapolis protests
Tülay Hatimogullari: 'Ankara's policy in favor of Damascus undermined negotiations with the Kurds in Turkey'
French IT giant Capgemini to sell US subsidiary after row over ICE links
subhead: After being the subject of questions in Parliament and calls for transparency from the government, the company said the process of selling its US subsidiary would begin 'immediately.'

title: Two years after France introduced specialized units to combat domestic violence, results are mixed
subhead: The French Justice Ministry says most judicial and appeal courts have set up these units, which aim to provide a cross-disciplinary approach to handling domestic violence cases. On the ground, however, advocacy groups and lawyers remain cautious about the reform's impact.

title: Israel to end Doctors Without Borders work in Gaza
subhead: Israel said Sunday it would end the work of Doctors Without Borders in Gaza after it failed to provide a list of its Palestinian staff.

Blocking the Russian army: Ukraine's impossible mission
subhead: With limited technical and human resources, soldiers and engineers in these units, increasingly exposed to drone fire, are trying to contain the Russian army, which continues to make slow but steady advances.

title: 'The only thing left to do is leave': Cuba pushed to the brink
subhead: 'Cuba, an island adrift' (2/3). Since the wave of unrest that swept the country in 2021, more than two million Cubans have fled. Those who remain on the island scrape by with varying degrees of success, as the exorbitant price of basic goods has become a source of inequality between those with nothing and those with access to foreign currency.

title: 'Facing Trump, Europe, Canada and Latin America have to navigate between misalignment, non-alignment and avoidance'
subhead: The sweeping powers that the US president has granted himself through his Board of Peace serve only to discourage even the best intentions, observes Le Monde's columnist Gilles Paris.
